comment: Didn't get a lot from the professor's lectures. I really had to learn Java on my own (the book helps!). Luckily, the CS1301 concepts are pretty easy if you can already program or script.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I learned mostly from the book and a little from the powerpoints. She's terrible at responding to emails, usually just doesn't email back. Basically, shows up to class, gives her lecture then checks out. Online quizzes weren't opened on time. It's an easy class, but she doesn't seem to care. It's whatever is convenient for her.

Professor Nalamothu was great! The lectures are PowerPoint heavy, but she is still very engaged with the learning process. She cares about her students and about how well they understand the concepts. Due to the nature of the subject, she is very understanding when it comes to grading issues. Highly recommend taking her for programming.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great professor. Her accent can make it hard to understand the lecture at times. There were 3 test and a final. Two of the tests and the final were take home tests. There's not an unreasonable amound of work. 7-8 labs and a group project. She is very understanding and willing to help her students.

She is a decent professor. Lectures off of power points (also uploads on d2l). She never responded to my emails. 14 labs and assignments. 3 quizzes but they're all take home online quizzes. There are 2 tests which weren't that hard for me. The final was basically a test on the last few chapters. Knows material, not great at explaining it.

She is ok. She understands the material, but isn't good at presenting it. She just reads off of a PowerPoint, so you are going to have to learn a lot on your own. Though, she is very accessible outside of class. You can email or text her, and she responds often within the hour. There are 14 labs, 2 tests, 3 quizzes, and a cumulative written final.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took this class online. Overall she is a solid professor. Her english is a little broken and sometimes her directions arent very clear. But once you get over all that you will like her. The textbook is useful but she gives you a link to it. Would recommend taking it online.
Easy A. But you won't learn anything, AT ALL.

She is a good professor and would help you learn if you have questions. The course is easy and you really just need to complete assignments. The quizzes are tougher than tests for some reason but doesn't count as much so getting an A is easy.
You will learn a lot. Textbook is must and she is caring
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great professor who's willing to work with the students. She gives very clear lectures (what she teaches will be on the test). Easy to participate, great knowledge of programming. Examples are always relatable to anyone, makes it easier to understand concepts. Always very friendly! Hope she teaches more upper level courses so I can have her again!

She's ok. She clearly knows a lot about the subject. But her accent can be hard to understand, and her English tends to be broken. She writes her own tests, and you're likely to miss points because you couldn't understand what she wanted you to do. I recommend taking someone else to avoid communication errors and save your sanity.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Love this teacher, the class is tough but I swear to you she makes it so much easier and is willing to work with you and not out to make it hard for you. I am currently taking her now and I was nervous at first but she makes things fun and try to engage us as much as possible. I take this class at night and she does a good job not making it boring.
